67static void update_line PARAMS((char *, char *, int, int, int, int));
68static void space_to_eol PARAMS((int));
69static void delete_chars PARAMS((int));
70static void insert_some_chars PARAMS((char *, int, int));

73/* State of visible and invisible lines. */
74struct line_state
75 {
76 char *line;
77 int *lbreaks;
78 int lbsize;
79#if defined (HANDLE_MULTIBYTE)
80 int *wrapped_line;
81 int wbsize;
82#endif
83 };
84
85/* The line display buffers. One is the line currently displayed on
86 the screen. The other is the line about to be displayed. */
87static struct line_state line_state_array[2];
88static struct line_state *line_state_visible = &line_state_array[0];
89static struct line_state *line_state_invisible = &line_state_array[1];
90static int line_structures_initialized = 0;
91
92/* Backwards-compatible names. */
93#define inv_lbreaks (line_state_invisible->lbreaks)
94#define inv_lbsize (line_state_invisible->lbsize)
95#define vis_lbreaks (line_state_visible->lbreaks)
96#define vis_lbsize (line_state_visible->lbsize)
97
98#define visible_line (line_state_visible->line)
99#define invisible_line (line_state_invisible->line)
100
101#if defined (HANDLE_MULTIBYTE)
102static int _rl_col_width PARAMS((const char *, int, int, int));
103#else
104# define _rl_col_width(l, s, e, f) (((e) <= (s)) ? 0 : (e) - (s))
105#endif
106
107/* Heuristic used to decide whether it is faster to move from CUR to NEW
108 by backing up or outputting a carriage return and moving forward. CUR
109 and NEW are either both buffer positions or absolute screen positions. */
110#define CR_FASTER(new, cur) (((new) + 1) < ((cur) - (new)))
111
112/* _rl_last_c_pos is an absolute cursor position in multibyte locales and a
113 buffer index in others. This macro is used when deciding whether the
114 current cursor position is in the middle of a prompt string containing
115 invisible characters. XXX - might need to take `modmark' into account. */
116#define PROMPT_ENDING_INDEX \
117 ((MB_CUR_MAX > 1 && rl_byte_oriented == 0) ? prompt_physical_chars : prompt_last_invisible+1)
118

121/* */
122/* Display stuff */
123/* */
124/* **************************************************************** */
125
126/* This is the stuff that is hard for me. I never seem to write good
127 display routines in C. Let's see how I do this time. */
128
129/* (PWP) Well... Good for a simple line updater, but totally ignores
130 the problems of input lines longer than the screen width.
131
132 update_line and the code that calls it makes a multiple line,
133 automatically wrapping line update. Careful attention needs
134 to be paid to the vertical position variables. */
135
136/* Keep two buffers; one which reflects the current contents of the
137 screen, and the other to draw what we think the new contents should
138 be. Then compare the buffers, and make whatever changes to the
139 screen itself that we should. Finally, make the buffer that we
140 just drew into be the one which reflects the current contents of the
141 screen, and place the cursor where it belongs.
142
143 Commands that want to can fix the display themselves, and then let
144 this function know that the display has been fixed by setting the
145 RL_DISPLAY_FIXED variable. This is good for efficiency. */
146
147/* Application-specific redisplay function. */
148rl_voidfunc_t *rl_redisplay_function = rl_redisplay;
149
150/* Global variables declared here. */
151/* What YOU turn on when you have handled all redisplay yourself. */
152int rl_display_fixed = 0;
153
154int _rl_suppress_redisplay = 0;
155int _rl_want_redisplay = 0;
156
157/* The stuff that gets printed out before the actual text of the line.
158 This is usually pointing to rl_prompt. */
159char *rl_display_prompt = (char *)NULL;
160
161/* Pseudo-global variables declared here. */
162
163/* The visible cursor position. If you print some text, adjust this. */
164/* NOTE: _rl_last_c_pos is used as a buffer index when not in a locale
165 supporting multibyte characters, and an absolute cursor position when
166 in such a locale. This is an artifact of the donated multibyte support.
167 Care must be taken when modifying its value. */
168int _rl_last_c_pos = 0;
169int _rl_last_v_pos = 0;
170
171static int cpos_adjusted;
172static int cpos_buffer_position;
173static int prompt_multibyte_chars;
174
175/* Number of lines currently on screen minus 1. */
176int _rl_vis_botlin = 0;
177
178/* Variables used only in this file. */
179/* The last left edge of text that was displayed. This is used when
180 doing horizontal scrolling. It shifts in thirds of a screenwidth. */
181static int last_lmargin;
182
183/* A buffer for `modeline' messages. */
184static char msg_buf[128];
185
186/* Non-zero forces the redisplay even if we thought it was unnecessary. */
187static int forced_display;
188
189/* Default and initial buffer size. Can grow. */
190static int line_size = 1024;
191
192/* Variables to keep track of the expanded prompt string, which may
193 include invisible characters. */
194
195static char *local_prompt, *local_prompt_prefix;
196static int local_prompt_len;
197static int prompt_visible_length, prompt_prefix_length;
198
199/* The number of invisible characters in the line currently being
200 displayed on the screen. */
201static int visible_wrap_offset;
202
203/* The number of invisible characters in the prompt string. Static so it
204 can be shared between rl_redisplay and update_line */
205static int wrap_offset;
206
207/* The index of the last invisible character in the prompt string. */
208static int prompt_last_invisible;
209
210/* The length (buffer offset) of the first line of the last (possibly
211 multi-line) buffer displayed on the screen. */
212static int visible_first_line_len;
213
214/* Number of invisible characters on the first physical line of the prompt.
215 Only valid when the number of physical characters in the prompt exceeds
216 (or is equal to) _rl_screenwidth. */
217static int prompt_invis_chars_first_line;
218
219static int prompt_last_screen_line;
220
221static int prompt_physical_chars;
222
223/* set to a non-zero value by rl_redisplay if we are marking modified history
224 lines and the current line is so marked. */
225static int modmark;
226
227/* Variables to save and restore prompt and display information. */
228
229/* These are getting numerous enough that it's time to create a struct. */
230
231static char *saved_local_prompt;
232static char *saved_local_prefix;
233static int saved_last_invisible;
234static int saved_visible_length;
235static int saved_prefix_length;
236static int saved_local_length;
237static int saved_invis_chars_first_line;
238static int saved_physical_chars;
239
240/* Expand the prompt string S and return the number of visible
241 characters in *LP, if LP is not null. This is currently more-or-less
242 a placeholder for expansion. LIP, if non-null is a place to store the
243 index of the last invisible character in the returned string. NIFLP,
244 if non-zero, is a place to store the number of invisible characters in
245 the first prompt line. The previous are used as byte counts -- indexes
246 into a character buffer. */
247
248/* Current implementation:
249 \001 (^A) start non-visible characters
250 \002 (^B) end non-visible characters
251 all characters except \001 and \002 (following a \001) are copied to
252 the returned string; all characters except those between \001 and
253 \002 are assumed to be `visible'. */
254
255static char *
256expand_prompt (pmt, lp, lip, niflp, vlp)
257 char *pmt;
258 int *lp, *lip, *niflp, *vlp;
259{
260 char *r, *ret, *p, *igstart;
261 int l, rl, last, ignoring, ninvis, invfl, invflset, ind, pind, physchars;
262
263 /* Short-circuit if we can. */
264 if ((MB_CUR_MAX <= 1 || rl_byte_oriented) && strchr (pmt, RL_PROMPT_START_IGNORE) == 0)
265 {
266 r = savestring (pmt);
267 if (lp)
268 *lp = strlen (r);
269 if (lip)
270 *lip = 0;
271 if (niflp)
272 *niflp = 0;
273 if (vlp)
274 *vlp = lp ? *lp : strlen (r);
275 return r;
276 }
277
278 l = strlen (pmt);
279 r = ret = (char *)xmalloc (l + 1);
280
281 invfl = 0; /* invisible chars in first line of prompt */
282 invflset = 0; /* we only want to set invfl once */
283
284 igstart = 0;
285 for (rl = ignoring = last = ninvis = physchars = 0, p = pmt; p && *p; p++)
286 {
287 /* This code strips the invisible character string markers
288 RL_PROMPT_START_IGNORE and RL_PROMPT_END_IGNORE */
289 if (ignoring == 0 && *p == RL_PROMPT_START_IGNORE) /* XXX - check ignoring? */
290 {
291 ignoring = 1;
292 igstart = p;
293 continue;
294 }
295 else if (ignoring && *p == RL_PROMPT_END_IGNORE)
296 {
297 ignoring = 0;
298 if (p != (igstart + 1))
299 last = r - ret - 1;
300 continue;
301 }
302 else
303 {
304#if defined (HANDLE_MULTIBYTE)
305 if (MB_CUR_MAX > 1 && rl_byte_oriented == 0)
306 {
307 pind = p - pmt;
308 ind = _rl_find_next_mbchar (pmt, pind, 1, MB_FIND_NONZERO);
309 l = ind - pind;
310 while (l--)
311 *r++ = *p++;
312 if (!ignoring)
313 {
314 /* rl ends up being assigned to prompt_visible_length,
315 which is the number of characters in the buffer that
316 contribute to characters on the screen, which might
317 not be the same as the number of physical characters
318 on the screen in the presence of multibyte characters */
319 rl += ind - pind;
320 physchars += _rl_col_width (pmt, pind, ind, 0);
321 }
322 else
323 ninvis += ind - pind;
324 p--; /* compensate for later increment */
325 }
326 else
327#endif
328 {
329 *r++ = *p;
330 if (!ignoring)
331 {
332 rl++; /* visible length byte counter */
333 physchars++;
334 }
335 else
336 ninvis++; /* invisible chars byte counter */
337 }
338
339 if (invflset == 0 && rl >= _rl_screenwidth)
340 {
341 invfl = ninvis;
342 invflset = 1;
343 }
344 }
345 }
346
347 if (rl < _rl_screenwidth)
348 invfl = ninvis;
349
350 *r = '\0';
351 if (lp)
352 *lp = rl;
353 if (lip)
354 *lip = last;
355 if (niflp)
356 *niflp = invfl;
357 if (vlp)
358 *vlp = physchars;
359 return ret;
360}
361
362/* Just strip out RL_PROMPT_START_IGNORE and RL_PROMPT_END_IGNORE from
363 PMT and return the rest of PMT. */
364char *
365_rl_strip_prompt (pmt)
366 char *pmt;
367{
368 char *ret;
369
370 ret = expand_prompt (pmt, (int *)NULL, (int *)NULL, (int *)NULL, (int *)NULL);
371 return ret;
372}
373
374/*
375 * Expand the prompt string into the various display components, if
376 * necessary.
377 *
378 * local_prompt = expanded last line of string in rl_display_prompt
379 * (portion after the final newline)
380 * local_prompt_prefix = portion before last newline of rl_display_prompt,
381 * expanded via expand_prompt
382 * prompt_visible_length = number of visible characters in local_prompt
383 * prompt_prefix_length = number of visible characters in local_prompt_prefix
384 *
385 * This function is called once per call to readline(). It may also be
386 * called arbitrarily to expand the primary prompt.
387 *
388 * The return value is the number of visible characters on the last line
389 * of the (possibly multi-line) prompt.
390 */
391int
392rl_expand_prompt (prompt)
393 char *prompt;
394{
395 char *p, *t;
396 int c;
397
398 /* Clear out any saved values. */
399 FREE (local_prompt);
400 FREE (local_prompt_prefix);
401
402 local_prompt = local_prompt_prefix = (char *)0;
403 local_prompt_len = 0;
404 prompt_last_invisible = prompt_invis_chars_first_line = 0;
405 prompt_visible_length = prompt_physical_chars = 0;
406
407 if (prompt == 0 || *prompt == 0)
408 return (0);
409
410 p = strrchr (prompt, '\n');
411 if (!p)
412 {
413 /* The prompt is only one logical line, though it might wrap. */
414 local_prompt = expand_prompt (prompt, &prompt_visible_length,
415 &prompt_last_invisible,
416 &prompt_invis_chars_first_line,
417 &prompt_physical_chars);
418 local_prompt_prefix = (char *)0;
419 local_prompt_len = local_prompt ? strlen (local_prompt) : 0;
420 return (prompt_visible_length);
421 }
422 else
423 {
424 /* The prompt spans multiple lines. */
425 t = ++p;
426 local_prompt = expand_prompt (p, &prompt_visible_length,
427 &prompt_last_invisible,
428 &prompt_invis_chars_first_line,
429 &prompt_physical_chars);
430 c = *t; *t = '\0';
431 /* The portion of the prompt string up to and including the
432 final newline is now null-terminated. */
433 local_prompt_prefix = expand_prompt (prompt, &prompt_prefix_length,
434 (int *)NULL,
435 (int *)NULL,
436 (int *)NULL);
437 *t = c;
438 local_prompt_len = local_prompt ? strlen (local_prompt) : 0;
439 return (prompt_prefix_length);
440 }
441}
442
443/* Initialize the VISIBLE_LINE and INVISIBLE_LINE arrays, and their associated
444 arrays of line break markers. MINSIZE is the minimum size of VISIBLE_LINE
445 and INVISIBLE_LINE; if it is greater than LINE_SIZE, LINE_SIZE is
446 increased. If the lines have already been allocated, this ensures that
447 they can hold at least MINSIZE characters. */
448static void
449init_line_structures (minsize)
450 int minsize;
451{
452 register int n;
453
454 if (invisible_line == 0) /* initialize it */
455 {
456 if (line_size < minsize)
457 line_size = minsize;
458 visible_line = (char *)xmalloc (line_size);
459 invisible_line = (char *)xmalloc (line_size);
460 }
461 else if (line_size < minsize) /* ensure it can hold MINSIZE chars */
462 {
463 line_size *= 2;
464 if (line_size < minsize)
465 line_size = minsize;
466 visible_line = (char *)xrealloc (visible_line, line_size);
467 invisible_line = (char *)xrealloc (invisible_line, line_size);
468 }
469
470 for (n = minsize; n < line_size; n++)
471 {
472 visible_line[n] = 0;
473 invisible_line[n] = 1;
474 }
475
476 if (vis_lbreaks == 0)
477 {
478 /* should be enough. */
479 inv_lbsize = vis_lbsize = 256;
480
481#if defined (HANDLE_MULTIBYTE)
482 line_state_visible->wbsize = vis_lbsize;
483 line_state_visible->wrapped_line = (int *)xmalloc (line_state_visible->wbsize * sizeof (int));
484
485 line_state_invisible->wbsize = inv_lbsize;
486 line_state_invisible->wrapped_line = (int *)xmalloc (line_state_invisible->wbsize * sizeof (int));
487#endif
488
489 inv_lbreaks = (int *)xmalloc (inv_lbsize * sizeof (int));
490 vis_lbreaks = (int *)xmalloc (vis_lbsize * sizeof (int));
491 inv_lbreaks[0] = vis_lbreaks[0] = 0;
492 }
493
494 line_structures_initialized = 1;
495}
496
497/* Basic redisplay algorithm. */
498void
499rl_redisplay ()
500{
501 register int in, out, c, linenum, cursor_linenum;
502 register char *line;
503 int inv_botlin, lb_botlin, lb_linenum, o_cpos;
504 int newlines, lpos, temp, n0, num, prompt_lines_estimate;
505 char *prompt_this_line;
506#if defined (HANDLE_MULTIBYTE)
507 wchar_t wc;
508 size_t wc_bytes;
509 int wc_width;
510 mbstate_t ps;
511 int _rl_wrapped_multicolumn = 0;
512#endif
513
514 if (_rl_echoing_p == 0)
515 return;
516
517 /* Block keyboard interrupts because this function manipulates global
518 data structures. */
519 _rl_block_sigint ();
520 RL_SETSTATE (RL_STATE_REDISPLAYING);
521
522 if (!rl_display_prompt)
523 rl_display_prompt = "";
524
525 if (line_structures_initialized == 0)
526 {
527 init_line_structures (0);
528 rl_on_new_line ();
529 }
530
531 /* Draw the line into the buffer. */
532 cpos_buffer_position = -1;
533
534 prompt_multibyte_chars = prompt_visible_length - prompt_physical_chars;
535
536 line = invisible_line;
537 out = inv_botlin = 0;
538
539 /* Mark the line as modified or not. We only do this for history
540 lines. */
541 modmark = 0;
542 if (_rl_mark_modified_lines && current_history () && rl_undo_list)
543 {
544 line[out++] = '*';
545 line[out] = '\0';
546 modmark = 1;
547 }
548
549 /* If someone thought that the redisplay was handled, but the currently
550 visible line has a different modification state than the one about
551 to become visible, then correct the caller's misconception. */
552 if (visible_line[0] != invisible_line[0])
553 rl_display_fixed = 0;
554
555 /* If the prompt to be displayed is the `primary' readline prompt (the
556 one passed to readline()), use the values we have already expanded.
557 If not, use what's already in rl_display_prompt. WRAP_OFFSET is the
558 number of non-visible characters in the prompt string. */
559 if (rl_display_prompt == rl_prompt || local_prompt)
560 {
561 if (local_prompt_prefix && forced_display)
562 _rl_output_some_chars (local_prompt_prefix, strlen (local_prompt_prefix));
563
564 if (local_prompt_len > 0)
565 {
566 temp = local_prompt_len + out + 2;
567 if (temp >= line_size)
568 {
569 line_size = (temp + 1024) - (temp % 1024);
570 visible_line = (char *)xrealloc (visible_line, line_size);
571 line = invisible_line = (char *)xrealloc (invisible_line, line_size);
572 }
573 strncpy (line + out, local_prompt, local_prompt_len);
574 out += local_prompt_len;
575 }
576 line[out] = '\0';
577 wrap_offset = local_prompt_len - prompt_visible_length;
578 }
579 else
580 {
581 int pmtlen;
582 prompt_this_line = strrchr (rl_display_prompt, '\n');
583 if (!prompt_this_line)
584 prompt_this_line = rl_display_prompt;
585 else
586 {
587 prompt_this_line++;
588 pmtlen = prompt_this_line - rl_display_prompt; /* temp var */
589 if (forced_display)
590 {
591 _rl_output_some_chars (rl_display_prompt, pmtlen);
592 /* Make sure we are at column zero even after a newline,
593 regardless of the state of terminal output processing. */
594 if (pmtlen < 2 || prompt_this_line[-2] != '\r')
595 cr ();
596 }
597 }
598
599 prompt_physical_chars = pmtlen = strlen (prompt_this_line);
600 temp = pmtlen + out + 2;
601 if (temp >= line_size)
602 {
603 line_size = (temp + 1024) - (temp % 1024);
604 visible_line = (char *)xrealloc (visible_line, line_size);
605 line = invisible_line = (char *)xrealloc (invisible_line, line_size);
606 }
607 strncpy (line + out, prompt_this_line, pmtlen);
608 out += pmtlen;
609 line[out] = '\0';
610 wrap_offset = prompt_invis_chars_first_line = 0;
611 }
612
613#define CHECK_INV_LBREAKS() \
614 do { \
615 if (newlines >= (inv_lbsize - 2)) \
616 { \
617 inv_lbsize *= 2; \
618 inv_lbreaks = (int *)xrealloc (inv_lbreaks, inv_lbsize * sizeof (int)); \
619 } \
620 } while (0)
621
622#if defined (HANDLE_MULTIBYTE)
623#define CHECK_LPOS() \
624 do { \
625 lpos++; \
626 if (lpos >= _rl_screenwidth) \
627 { \
628 if (newlines >= (inv_lbsize - 2)) \
629 { \
630 inv_lbsize *= 2; \
631 inv_lbreaks = (int *)xrealloc (inv_lbreaks, inv_lbsize * sizeof (int)); \
632 } \
633 inv_lbreaks[++newlines] = out; \
634 if (newlines >= (line_state_invisible->wbsize - 1)) \
635 { \
636 line_state_invisible->wbsize *= 2; \
637 line_state_invisible->wrapped_line = (int *)xrealloc (line_state_invisible->wrapped_line, line_state_invisible->wbsize * sizeof(int)); \
638 } \
639 line_state_invisible->wrapped_line[newlines] = _rl_wrapped_multicolumn; \
640 lpos = 0; \
641 } \
642 } while (0)
643#else
644#define CHECK_LPOS() \
645 do { \
646 lpos++; \
647 if (lpos >= _rl_screenwidth) \
648 { \
649 if (newlines >= (inv_lbsize - 2)) \
650 { \
651 inv_lbsize *= 2; \
652 inv_lbreaks = (int *)xrealloc (inv_lbreaks, inv_lbsize * sizeof (int)); \
653 } \
654 inv_lbreaks[++newlines] = out; \
655 lpos = 0; \
656 } \
657 } while (0)
658#endif
659
660 /* inv_lbreaks[i] is where line i starts in the buffer. */
661 inv_lbreaks[newlines = 0] = 0;
662 lpos = prompt_physical_chars + modmark;
663
664#if defined (HANDLE_MULTIBYTE)
665 memset (line_state_invisible->wrapped_line, 0, line_state_invisible->wbsize * sizeof (int));
666 num = 0;
667#endif
668
669 /* prompt_invis_chars_first_line is the number of invisible characters in
670 the first physical line of the prompt.
671 wrap_offset - prompt_invis_chars_first_line is the number of invis
672 chars on the second (or, more generally, last) line. */
673
674 /* This is zero-based, used to set the newlines */
675 prompt_lines_estimate = lpos / _rl_screenwidth;
676
677 /* what if lpos is already >= _rl_screenwidth before we start drawing the
678 contents of the command line? */
679 while (lpos >= _rl_screenwidth)
680 {
681 int z;
682 /* fix from Darin Johnson <darin@acuson.com> for prompt string with
683 invisible characters that is longer than the screen width. The
684 prompt_invis_chars_first_line variable could be made into an array
685 saying how many invisible characters there are per line, but that's
686 probably too much work for the benefit gained. How many people have
687 prompts that exceed two physical lines?
688 Additional logic fix from Edward Catmur <ed@catmur.co.uk> */
689#if defined (HANDLE_MULTIBYTE)
690 if (MB_CUR_MAX > 1 && rl_byte_oriented == 0 && prompt_multibyte_chars > 0)
691 {
692 n0 = num;
693 temp = local_prompt_len;
694 while (num < temp)
695 {
696 z = _rl_col_width (local_prompt, n0, num, 1);
697 if (z > _rl_screenwidth)
698 {
699 num = _rl_find_prev_mbchar (local_prompt, num, MB_FIND_ANY);
700 break;
701 }
702 else if (z == _rl_screenwidth)
703 break;
704 num++;
705 }
706 temp = num;
707 }
708 else
709#endif /* !HANDLE_MULTIBYTE */
710 temp = ((newlines + 1) * _rl_screenwidth);
711
712 /* Now account for invisible characters in the current line. */
713 /* XXX - this assumes that the invisible characters may be split, but only
714 between the first and the last lines. */
715 temp += ((local_prompt_prefix == 0) ? ((newlines == 0) ? prompt_invis_chars_first_line
716 : ((newlines == prompt_lines_estimate) ? wrap_offset : prompt_invis_chars_first_line))
717 : ((newlines == 0) ? wrap_offset : 0));
718
719 inv_lbreaks[++newlines] = temp;
720#if defined (HANDLE_MULTIBYTE)
721 if (MB_CUR_MAX > 1 && rl_byte_oriented == 0 && prompt_multibyte_chars > 0)
722 lpos -= _rl_col_width (local_prompt, n0, num, 1);
723 else
724#endif
725 lpos -= _rl_screenwidth;
726 }
727
728 prompt_last_screen_line = newlines;
729
730 /* Draw the rest of the line (after the prompt) into invisible_line, keeping
731 track of where the cursor is (cpos_buffer_position), the number of the line containing
732 the cursor (lb_linenum), the last line number (lb_botlin and inv_botlin).
733 It maintains an array of line breaks for display (inv_lbreaks).
734 This handles expanding tabs for display and displaying meta characters. */
735 lb_linenum = 0;
736#if defined (HANDLE_MULTIBYTE)
737 in = 0;
738 if (MB_CUR_MAX > 1 && rl_byte_oriented == 0)
739 {
740 memset (&ps, 0, sizeof (mbstate_t));
741 /* XXX - what if wc_bytes ends up <= 0? check for MB_INVALIDCH */
742 wc_bytes = mbrtowc (&wc, rl_line_buffer, rl_end, &ps);
743 }
744 else
745 wc_bytes = 1;
746 while (in < rl_end)
747#else
748 for (in = 0; in < rl_end; in++)
749#endif
750 {
751 c = (unsigned char)rl_line_buffer[in];
752
753#if defined (HANDLE_MULTIBYTE)
754 if (MB_CUR_MAX > 1 && rl_byte_oriented == 0)
755 {
756 if (MB_INVALIDCH (wc_bytes))
757 {
758 /* Byte sequence is invalid or shortened. Assume that the
759 first byte represents a character. */
760 wc_bytes = 1;
761 /* Assume that a character occupies a single column. */
762 wc_width = 1;
763 memset (&ps, 0, sizeof (mbstate_t));
764 }
765 else if (MB_NULLWCH (wc_bytes))
766 break; /* Found '\0' */
767 else
768 {
769 temp = wcwidth (wc);
770 wc_width = (temp >= 0) ? temp : 1;
771 }
772 }
773#endif
774
775 if (out + 8 >= line_size) /* XXX - 8 for \t */
776 {
777 line_size *= 2;
778 visible_line = (char *)xrealloc (visible_line, line_size);
779 invisible_line = (char *)xrealloc (invisible_line, line_size);
780 line = invisible_line;
781 }
782
783 if (in == rl_point)
784 {
785 cpos_buffer_position = out;
786 lb_linenum = newlines;
787 }
788
789#if defined (HANDLE_MULTIBYTE)
790 if (META_CHAR (c) && _rl_output_meta_chars == 0) /* XXX - clean up */
791#else
792 if (META_CHAR (c))
793#endif
794 {
795 if (_rl_output_meta_chars == 0)
796 {
797 sprintf (line + out, "\\%o", c);
798
799 if (lpos + 4 >= _rl_screenwidth)
800 {
801 temp = _rl_screenwidth - lpos;
802 CHECK_INV_LBREAKS ();
803 inv_lbreaks[++newlines] = out + temp;
804 lpos = 4 - temp;
805 }
806 else
807 lpos += 4;
808
809 out += 4;
810 }
811 else
812 {
813 line[out++] = c;
814 CHECK_LPOS();
815 }
816 }
817#if defined (DISPLAY_TABS)
818 else if (c == '\t')
819 {
820 register int newout;
821
822#if 0
823 newout = (out | (int)7) + 1;
824#else
825 newout = out + 8 - lpos % 8;
826#endif
827 temp = newout - out;
828 if (lpos + temp >= _rl_screenwidth)
829 {
830 register int temp2;
831 temp2 = _rl_screenwidth - lpos;
832 CHECK_INV_LBREAKS ();
833 inv_lbreaks[++newlines] = out + temp2;
834 lpos = temp - temp2;
835 while (out < newout)
836 line[out++] = ' ';
837 }
838 else
839 {
840 while (out < newout)
841 line[out++] = ' ';
842 lpos += temp;
843 }
844 }
845#endif
846 else if (c == '\n' && _rl_horizontal_scroll_mode == 0 && _rl_term_up && *_rl_term_up)
847 {
848 line[out++] = '\0'; /* XXX - sentinel */
849 CHECK_INV_LBREAKS ();
850 inv_lbreaks[++newlines] = out;
851 lpos = 0;
852 }
853 else if (CTRL_CHAR (c) || c == RUBOUT)
854 {
855 line[out++] = '^';
856 CHECK_LPOS();
857 line[out++] = CTRL_CHAR (c) ? UNCTRL (c) : '?';
858 CHECK_LPOS();
859 }
860 else
861 {
862#if defined (HANDLE_MULTIBYTE)
863 if (MB_CUR_MAX > 1 && rl_byte_oriented == 0)
864 {
865 register int i;
866
867 _rl_wrapped_multicolumn = 0;
868
869 if (_rl_screenwidth < lpos + wc_width)
870 for (i = lpos; i < _rl_screenwidth; i++)
871 {
872 /* The space will be removed in update_line() */
873 line[out++] = ' ';
874 _rl_wrapped_multicolumn++;
875 CHECK_LPOS();
876 }
877 if (in == rl_point)
878 {
879 cpos_buffer_position = out;
880 lb_linenum = newlines;
881 }
882 for (i = in; i < in+wc_bytes; i++)
883 line[out++] = rl_line_buffer[i];
884 for (i = 0; i < wc_width; i++)
885 CHECK_LPOS();
886 }
887 else
888 {
889 line[out++] = c;
890 CHECK_LPOS();
891 }
892#else
893 line[out++] = c;
894 CHECK_LPOS();
895#endif
896 }
897
898#if defined (HANDLE_MULTIBYTE)
899 if (MB_CUR_MAX > 1 && rl_byte_oriented == 0)
900 {
901 in += wc_bytes;
902 /* XXX - what if wc_bytes ends up <= 0? check for MB_INVALIDCH */
903 wc_bytes = mbrtowc (&wc, rl_line_buffer + in, rl_end - in, &ps);
904 }
905 else
906 in++;
907#endif
908
909 }
910 line[out] = '\0';
911 if (cpos_buffer_position < 0)
912 {
913 cpos_buffer_position = out;
914 lb_linenum = newlines;
915 }
916
917 inv_botlin = lb_botlin = newlines;
918 CHECK_INV_LBREAKS ();
919 inv_lbreaks[newlines+1] = out;
920 cursor_linenum = lb_linenum;
921
922 /* CPOS_BUFFER_POSITION == position in buffer where cursor should be placed.
923 CURSOR_LINENUM == line number where the cursor should be placed. */
924
925 /* PWP: now is when things get a bit hairy. The visible and invisible
926 line buffers are really multiple lines, which would wrap every
927 (screenwidth - 1) characters. Go through each in turn, finding
928 the changed region and updating it. The line order is top to bottom. */
929
930 /* If we can move the cursor up and down, then use multiple lines,
931 otherwise, let long lines display in a single terminal line, and
932 horizontally scroll it. */
933
934 if (_rl_horizontal_scroll_mode == 0 && _rl_term_up && *_rl_term_up)
935 {
936 int nleft, pos, changed_screen_line, tx;
937
938 if (!rl_display_fixed || forced_display)
939 {
940 forced_display = 0;
941
942 /* If we have more than a screenful of material to display, then
943 only display a screenful. We should display the last screen,
944 not the first. */
945 if (out >= _rl_screenchars)
946 {
947 if (MB_CUR_MAX > 1 && rl_byte_oriented == 0)
948 out = _rl_find_prev_mbchar (line, _rl_screenchars, MB_FIND_ANY);
949 else
950 out = _rl_screenchars - 1;
951 }
952
953 /* The first line is at character position 0 in the buffer. The
954 second and subsequent lines start at inv_lbreaks[N], offset by
955 OFFSET (which has already been calculated above). */
956
957#define INVIS_FIRST() (prompt_physical_chars > _rl_screenwidth ? prompt_invis_chars_first_line : wrap_offset)
958#define WRAP_OFFSET(line, offset) ((line == 0) \
959 ? (offset ? INVIS_FIRST() : 0) \
960 : ((line == prompt_last_screen_line) ? wrap_offset-prompt_invis_chars_first_line : 0))
961#define W_OFFSET(line, offset) ((line) == 0 ? offset : 0)
962#define VIS_LLEN(l) ((l) > _rl_vis_botlin ? 0 : (vis_lbreaks[l+1] - vis_lbreaks[l]))
963#define INV_LLEN(l) (inv_lbreaks[l+1] - inv_lbreaks[l])
964#define VIS_CHARS(line) (visible_line + vis_lbreaks[line])
965#define VIS_LINE(line) ((line) > _rl_vis_botlin) ? "" : VIS_CHARS(line)
966#define INV_LINE(line) (invisible_line + inv_lbreaks[line])
967
968#define OLD_CPOS_IN_PROMPT() (cpos_adjusted == 0 && \
969 _rl_last_c_pos != o_cpos && \
970 _rl_last_c_pos > wrap_offset && \
971 o_cpos < prompt_last_invisible)
972
973 /* For each line in the buffer, do the updating display. */
974 for (linenum = 0; linenum <= inv_botlin; linenum++)
975 {
976 /* This can lead us astray if we execute a program that changes
977 the locale from a non-multibyte to a multibyte one. */
978 o_cpos = _rl_last_c_pos;
979 cpos_adjusted = 0;
980 update_line (VIS_LINE(linenum), INV_LINE(linenum), linenum,
981 VIS_LLEN(linenum), INV_LLEN(linenum), inv_botlin);
982
983 /* update_line potentially changes _rl_last_c_pos, but doesn't
984 take invisible characters into account, since _rl_last_c_pos
985 is an absolute cursor position in a multibyte locale. See
986 if compensating here is the right thing, or if we have to
987 change update_line itself. There are several cases in which
988 update_line adjusts _rl_last_c_pos itself (so it can pass
989 _rl_move_cursor_relative accurate values); it communicates
990 this back by setting cpos_adjusted. If we assume that
991 _rl_last_c_pos is correct (an absolute cursor position) each
992 time update_line is called, then we can assume in our
993 calculations that o_cpos does not need to be adjusted by
994 wrap_offset. */
995 if (linenum == 0 && (MB_CUR_MAX > 1 && rl_byte_oriented == 0) && OLD_CPOS_IN_PROMPT())
996 _rl_last_c_pos -= prompt_invis_chars_first_line; /* XXX - was wrap_offset */
997 else if (linenum == prompt_last_screen_line && prompt_physical_chars > _rl_screenwidth &&
998 (MB_CUR_MAX > 1 && rl_byte_oriented == 0) &&
999 cpos_adjusted == 0 &&
1000 _rl_last_c_pos != o_cpos &&
1001 _rl_last_c_pos > (prompt_last_invisible - _rl_screenwidth - prompt_invis_chars_first_line))
1002 _rl_last_c_pos -= (wrap_offset-prompt_invis_chars_first_line);
1003
1004 /* If this is the line with the prompt, we might need to
1005 compensate for invisible characters in the new line. Do
1006 this only if there is not more than one new line (which
1007 implies that we completely overwrite the old visible line)
1008 and the new line is shorter than the old. Make sure we are
1009 at the end of the new line before clearing. */
1010 if (linenum == 0 &&
1011 inv_botlin == 0 && _rl_last_c_pos == out &&
1012 (wrap_offset > visible_wrap_offset) &&
1013 (_rl_last_c_pos < visible_first_line_len))
1014 {
1015 if (MB_CUR_MAX > 1 && rl_byte_oriented == 0)
1016 nleft = _rl_screenwidth - _rl_last_c_pos;
1017 else
1018 nleft = _rl_screenwidth + wrap_offset - _rl_last_c_pos;
1019 if (nleft)
1020 _rl_clear_to_eol (nleft);
1021 }
1022#if 0
1023 /* This segment is intended to handle the case where the prompt
1024 has invisible characters on the second line and the new line
1025 to be displayed needs to clear the rest of the old characters
1026 out (e.g., when printing the i-search prompt). In general,
1027 the case of the new line being shorter than the old.
1028 Incomplete */
1029 else if (linenum == prompt_last_screen_line &&
1030 prompt_physical_chars > _rl_screenwidth &&
1031 wrap_offset != prompt_invis_chars_first_line &&
1032 _rl_last_c_pos == out &&
1033#endif
1034
1035
1036 /* Since the new first line is now visible, save its length. */
1037 if (linenum == 0)
1038 visible_first_line_len = (inv_botlin > 0) ? inv_lbreaks[1] : out - wrap_offset;
1039 }
1040
1041 /* We may have deleted some lines. If so, clear the left over
1042 blank ones at the bottom out. */
1043 if (_rl_vis_botlin > inv_botlin)
1044 {
1045 char *tt;
1046 for (; linenum <= _rl_vis_botlin; linenum++)
1047 {
1048 tt = VIS_CHARS (linenum);
1049 _rl_move_vert (linenum);
1050 _rl_move_cursor_relative (0, tt);
1051 _rl_clear_to_eol
1052 ((linenum == _rl_vis_botlin) ? strlen (tt) : _rl_screenwidth);
1053 }
1054 }
1055 _rl_vis_botlin = inv_botlin;
1056
1057 /* CHANGED_SCREEN_LINE is set to 1 if we have moved to a
1058 different screen line during this redisplay. */
1059 changed_screen_line = _rl_last_v_pos != cursor_linenum;
1060 if (changed_screen_line)
1061 {
1062 _rl_move_vert (cursor_linenum);
1063 /* If we moved up to the line with the prompt using _rl_term_up,
1064 the physical cursor position on the screen stays the same,
1065 but the buffer position needs to be adjusted to account
1066 for invisible characters. */
1067 if ((MB_CUR_MAX == 1 || rl_byte_oriented) && cursor_linenum == 0 && wrap_offset)
1068 _rl_last_c_pos += wrap_offset;
1069 }
1070
1071 /* We have to reprint the prompt if it contains invisible
1072 characters, since it's not generally OK to just reprint
1073 the characters from the current cursor position. But we
1074 only need to reprint it if the cursor is before the last
1075 invisible character in the prompt string. */
1076 nleft = prompt_visible_length + wrap_offset;
1077 if (cursor_linenum == 0 && wrap_offset > 0 && _rl_last_c_pos > 0 &&
1078#if 0
1079 _rl_last_c_pos <= PROMPT_ENDING_INDEX && local_prompt)
1080#else
1081 _rl_last_c_pos < PROMPT_ENDING_INDEX && local_prompt)
1082#endif
1083 {
1084#if defined (__MSDOS__)
1085 putc ('\r', rl_outstream);
1086#else
1087 if (_rl_term_cr)
1088 tputs (_rl_term_cr, 1, _rl_output_character_function);
1089#endif
1090 if (modmark)
1091 _rl_output_some_chars ("*", 1);
1092
1093 _rl_output_some_chars (local_prompt, nleft);
1094 if (MB_CUR_MAX > 1 && rl_byte_oriented == 0)
1095 _rl_last_c_pos = _rl_col_width (local_prompt, 0, nleft, 1) - wrap_offset + modmark;
1096 else
1097 _rl_last_c_pos = nleft + modmark;
1098 }
1099
1100 /* Where on that line? And where does that line start
1101 in the buffer? */
1102 pos = inv_lbreaks[cursor_linenum];
1103 /* nleft == number of characters in the line buffer between the
1104 start of the line and the desired cursor position. */
1105 nleft = cpos_buffer_position - pos;
1106
1107 /* NLEFT is now a number of characters in a buffer. When in a
1108 multibyte locale, however, _rl_last_c_pos is an absolute cursor
1109 position that doesn't take invisible characters in the prompt
1110 into account. We use a fudge factor to compensate. */
1111
1112 /* Since _rl_backspace() doesn't know about invisible characters in the
1113 prompt, and there's no good way to tell it, we compensate for
1114 those characters here and call _rl_backspace() directly. */
1115 if (wrap_offset && cursor_linenum == 0 && nleft < _rl_last_c_pos)
1116 {
1117 /* TX == new physical cursor position in multibyte locale. */
1118 if (MB_CUR_MAX > 1 && rl_byte_oriented == 0)
1119 tx = _rl_col_width (&visible_line[pos], 0, nleft, 1) - visible_wrap_offset;
1120 else
1121 tx = nleft;
1122 if (tx >= 0 && _rl_last_c_pos > tx)
1123 {
1124 _rl_backspace (_rl_last_c_pos - tx); /* XXX */
1125 _rl_last_c_pos = tx;
1126 }
1127 }
1128
1129 /* We need to note that in a multibyte locale we are dealing with
1130 _rl_last_c_pos as an absolute cursor position, but moving to a
1131 point specified by a buffer position (NLEFT) that doesn't take
1132 invisible characters into account. */
1133 if (MB_CUR_MAX > 1 && rl_byte_oriented == 0)
1134 _rl_move_cursor_relative (nleft, &invisible_line[pos]);
1135 else if (nleft != _rl_last_c_pos)
1136 _rl_move_cursor_relative (nleft, &invisible_line[pos]);
1137 }
1138 }
1139 else /* Do horizontal scrolling. */
1140 {
1141#define M_OFFSET(margin, offset) ((margin) == 0 ? offset : 0)
1142 int lmargin, ndisp, nleft, phys_c_pos, t;
1143
1144 /* Always at top line. */
1145 _rl_last_v_pos = 0;
1146
1147 /* Compute where in the buffer the displayed line should start. This
1148 will be LMARGIN. */
1149
1150 /* The number of characters that will be displayed before the cursor. */
1151 ndisp = cpos_buffer_position - wrap_offset;
1152 nleft = prompt_visible_length + wrap_offset;
1153 /* Where the new cursor position will be on the screen. This can be
1154 longer than SCREENWIDTH; if it is, lmargin will be adjusted. */
1155 phys_c_pos = cpos_buffer_position - (last_lmargin ? last_lmargin : wrap_offset);
1156 t = _rl_screenwidth / 3;
1157
1158 /* If the number of characters had already exceeded the screenwidth,
1159 last_lmargin will be > 0. */
1160
1161 /* If the number of characters to be displayed is more than the screen
1162 width, compute the starting offset so that the cursor is about
1163 two-thirds of the way across the screen. */
1164 if (phys_c_pos > _rl_screenwidth - 2)
1165 {
1166 lmargin = cpos_buffer_position - (2 * t);
1167 if (lmargin < 0)
1168 lmargin = 0;
1169 /* If the left margin would be in the middle of a prompt with
1170 invisible characters, don't display the prompt at all. */
1171 if (wrap_offset && lmargin > 0 && lmargin < nleft)
1172 lmargin = nleft;
1173 }
1174 else if (ndisp < _rl_screenwidth - 2) /* XXX - was -1 */
1175 lmargin = 0;
1176 else if (phys_c_pos < 1)
1177 {
1178 /* If we are moving back towards the beginning of the line and
1179 the last margin is no longer correct, compute a new one. */
1180 lmargin = ((cpos_buffer_position - 1) / t) * t; /* XXX */
1181 if (wrap_offset && lmargin > 0 && lmargin < nleft)
1182 lmargin = nleft;
1183 }
1184 else
1185 lmargin = last_lmargin;
1186
1187 /* If the first character on the screen isn't the first character
1188 in the display line, indicate this with a special character. */
1189 if (lmargin > 0)
1190 line[lmargin] = '<';
1191
1192 /* If SCREENWIDTH characters starting at LMARGIN do not encompass
1193 the whole line, indicate that with a special character at the
1194 right edge of the screen. If LMARGIN is 0, we need to take the
1195 wrap offset into account. */
1196 t = lmargin + M_OFFSET (lmargin, wrap_offset) + _rl_screenwidth;
1197 if (t < out)
1198 line[t - 1] = '>';
1199
1200 if (rl_display_fixed == 0 || forced_display || lmargin != last_lmargin)
1201 {
1202 forced_display = 0;
1203 o_cpos = _rl_last_c_pos;
1204 cpos_adjusted = 0;
1205 update_line (&visible_line[last_lmargin],
1206 &invisible_line[lmargin],
1207 0,
1208 _rl_screenwidth + visible_wrap_offset,
1209 _rl_screenwidth + (lmargin ? 0 : wrap_offset),
1210 0);
1211
1212 if ((MB_CUR_MAX > 1 && rl_byte_oriented == 0) && OLD_CPOS_IN_PROMPT())
1213 _rl_last_c_pos -= prompt_invis_chars_first_line; /* XXX - was wrap_offset */
1214
1215 /* If the visible new line is shorter than the old, but the number
1216 of invisible characters is greater, and we are at the end of
1217 the new line, we need to clear to eol. */
1218 t = _rl_last_c_pos - M_OFFSET (lmargin, wrap_offset);
1219 if ((M_OFFSET (lmargin, wrap_offset) > visible_wrap_offset) &&
1220 (_rl_last_c_pos == out) &&
1221 t < visible_first_line_len)
1222 {
1223 nleft = _rl_screenwidth - t;
1224 _rl_clear_to_eol (nleft);
1225 }
1226 visible_first_line_len = out - lmargin - M_OFFSET (lmargin, wrap_offset);
1227 if (visible_first_line_len > _rl_screenwidth)
1228 visible_first_line_len = _rl_screenwidth;
1229
1230 _rl_move_cursor_relative (cpos_buffer_position - lmargin, &invisible_line[lmargin]);
1231 last_lmargin = lmargin;
1232 }
1233 }
1234 fflush (rl_outstream);
1235
1236 /* Swap visible and non-visible lines. */
1237 {
1238 struct line_state *vtemp = line_state_visible;
1239
1240 line_state_visible = line_state_invisible;
1241 line_state_invisible = vtemp;
1242
1243 rl_display_fixed = 0;
1244 /* If we are displaying on a single line, and last_lmargin is > 0, we
1245 are not displaying any invisible characters, so set visible_wrap_offset
1246 to 0. */
1247 if (_rl_horizontal_scroll_mode && last_lmargin)
1248 visible_wrap_offset = 0;
1249 else
1250 visible_wrap_offset = wrap_offset;
1251 }
1252
1253 RL_UNSETSTATE (RL_STATE_REDISPLAYING);
1254 _rl_release_sigint ();
1255}
1256
1257/* PWP: update_line() is based on finding the middle difference of each
1258 line on the screen; vis:
1259
1260 /old first difference
1261 /beginning of line | /old last same /old EOL
1262 v v v v
1263old: eddie> Oh, my little gruntle-buggy is to me, as lurgid as
1264new: eddie> Oh, my little buggy says to me, as lurgid as
1265 ^ ^ ^ ^
1266 \beginning of line | \new last same \new end of line
1267 \new first difference
1268
1269 All are character pointers for the sake of speed. Special cases for
1270 no differences, as well as for end of line additions must be handled.
1271
1272 Could be made even smarter, but this works well enough */
1273static void
1274update_line (old, new, current_line, omax, nmax, inv_botlin)
1275 register char *old, *new;
1276 int current_line, omax, nmax, inv_botlin;
1277{
1278 register char *ofd, *ols, *oe, *nfd, *nls, *ne;
1279 int temp, lendiff, wsatend, od, nd, twidth, o_cpos;
1280 int current_invis_chars;
1281 int col_lendiff, col_temp;
1282#if defined (HANDLE_MULTIBYTE)
1283 mbstate_t ps_new, ps_old;
1284 int new_offset, old_offset;
1285#endif
1286
1287 /* If we're at the right edge of a terminal that supports xn, we're
1288 ready to wrap around, so do so. This fixes problems with knowing
1289 the exact cursor position and cut-and-paste with certain terminal
1290 emulators. In this calculation, TEMP is the physical screen
1291 position of the cursor. */
1292 if (MB_CUR_MAX > 1 && rl_byte_oriented == 0)
1293 temp = _rl_last_c_pos;
1294 else
1295 temp = _rl_last_c_pos - WRAP_OFFSET (_rl_last_v_pos, visible_wrap_offset);
1296 if (temp == _rl_screenwidth && _rl_term_autowrap && !_rl_horizontal_scroll_mode
1297 && _rl_last_v_pos == current_line - 1)
1298 {
1299#if defined (HANDLE_MULTIBYTE)
1300 if (MB_CUR_MAX > 1 && rl_byte_oriented == 0)
1301 {
1302 wchar_t wc;
1303 mbstate_t ps;
1304 int tempwidth, bytes;
1305 size_t ret;
1306
1307 /* This fixes only double-column characters, but if the wrapped
1308 character comsumes more than three columns, spaces will be
1309 inserted in the string buffer. */
1310 if (current_line < line_state_visible->wbsize && line_state_visible->wrapped_line[current_line] > 0)
1311 _rl_clear_to_eol (line_state_visible->wrapped_line[current_line]);
1312
1313 memset (&ps, 0, sizeof (mbstate_t));
1314 ret = mbrtowc (&wc, new, MB_CUR_MAX, &ps);
1315 if (MB_INVALIDCH (ret))
1316 {
1317 tempwidth = 1;
1318 ret = 1;
1319 }
1320 else if (MB_NULLWCH (ret))
1321 tempwidth = 0;
1322 else
1323 tempwidth = wcwidth (wc);
1324
1325 if (tempwidth > 0)
1326 {
1327 int count, i;
1328 bytes = ret;
1329 for (count = 0; count < bytes; count++)
1330 putc (new[count], rl_outstream);
1331 _rl_last_c_pos = tempwidth;
1332 _rl_last_v_pos++;
1333 memset (&ps, 0, sizeof (mbstate_t));
1334 ret = mbrtowc (&wc, old, MB_CUR_MAX, &ps);
1335 if (ret != 0 && bytes != 0)
1336 {
1337 if (MB_INVALIDCH (ret))
1338 ret = 1;
1339 memmove (old+bytes, old+ret, strlen (old+ret));
1340 memcpy (old, new, bytes);
1341 /* Fix up indices if we copy data from one line to another */
1342 omax += bytes - ret;
1343 for (i = current_line+1; i < inv_botlin+1; i++)
1344 vis_lbreaks[i] += bytes - ret;
1345 }
1346 }
1347 else
1348 {
1349 putc (' ', rl_outstream);
1350 _rl_last_c_pos = 1;
1351 _rl_last_v_pos++;
1352 if (old[0] && new[0])
1353 old[0] = new[0];
1354 }
1355 }
1356 else
1357#endif
1358 {
1359 if (new[0])
1360 putc (new[0], rl_outstream);
1361 else
1362 putc (' ', rl_outstream);
1363 _rl_last_c_pos = 1;
1364 _rl_last_v_pos++;
1365 if (old[0] && new[0])
1366 old[0] = new[0];
1367 }
1368 }
1369
1370
1371 /* Find first difference. */
1372#if defined (HANDLE_MULTIBYTE)
1373 if (MB_CUR_MAX > 1 && rl_byte_oriented == 0)
1374 {
1375 /* See if the old line is a subset of the new line, so that the
1376 only change is adding characters. */
1377 temp = (omax < nmax) ? omax : nmax;
1378 if (memcmp (old, new, temp) == 0) /* adding at the end */
1379 {
1380 ofd = old + temp;
1381 nfd = new + temp;
1382 }
1383 else
1384 {
1385 memset (&ps_new, 0, sizeof(mbstate_t));
1386 memset (&ps_old, 0, sizeof(mbstate_t));
1387
1388 if (omax == nmax && STREQN (new, old, omax))
1389 {
1390 ofd = old + omax;
1391 nfd = new + nmax;
1392 }
1393 else
1394 {
1395 new_offset = old_offset = 0;
1396 for (ofd = old, nfd = new;
1397 (ofd - old < omax) && *ofd &&
1398 _rl_compare_chars(old, old_offset, &ps_old, new, new_offset, &ps_new); )
1399 {
1400 old_offset = _rl_find_next_mbchar (old, old_offset, 1, MB_FIND_ANY);
1401 new_offset = _rl_find_next_mbchar (new, new_offset, 1, MB_FIND_ANY);
1402 ofd = old + old_offset;
1403 nfd = new + new_offset;
1404 }
1405 }
1406 }
1407 }
1408 else
1409#endif
1410 for (ofd = old, nfd = new;
1411 (ofd - old < omax) && *ofd && (*ofd == *nfd);
1412 ofd++, nfd++)
1413 ;
1414
1415 /* Move to the end of the screen line. ND and OD are used to keep track
1416 of the distance between ne and new and oe and old, respectively, to
1417 move a subtraction out of each loop. */
1418 for (od = ofd - old, oe = ofd; od < omax && *oe; oe++, od++);
1419 for (nd = nfd - new, ne = nfd; nd < nmax && *ne; ne++, nd++);
1420
1421 /* If no difference, continue to next line. */
1422 if (ofd == oe && nfd == ne)
1423 return;
1424
1425 wsatend = 1; /* flag for trailing whitespace */
1426
1427#if defined (HANDLE_MULTIBYTE)
1428 if (MB_CUR_MAX > 1 && rl_byte_oriented == 0)
1429 {
1430 ols = old + _rl_find_prev_mbchar (old, oe - old, MB_FIND_ANY);
1431 nls = new + _rl_find_prev_mbchar (new, ne - new, MB_FIND_ANY);
1432 while ((ols > ofd) && (nls > nfd))
1433 {
1434 memset (&ps_old, 0, sizeof (mbstate_t));
1435 memset (&ps_new, 0, sizeof (mbstate_t));
1436
1437#if 0
1438 /* On advice from jir@yamato.ibm.com */
1439 _rl_adjust_point (old, ols - old, &ps_old);
1440 _rl_adjust_point (new, nls - new, &ps_new);
1441#endif
1442
1443 if (_rl_compare_chars (old, ols - old, &ps_old, new, nls - new, &ps_new) == 0)
1444 break;
1445
1446 if (*ols == ' ')
1447 wsatend = 0;
1448
1449 ols = old + _rl_find_prev_mbchar (old, ols - old, MB_FIND_ANY);
1450 nls = new + _rl_find_prev_mbchar (new, nls - new, MB_FIND_ANY);
1451 }
1452 }
1453 else
1454 {
1455#endif /* HANDLE_MULTIBYTE */
1456 ols = oe - 1; /* find last same */
1457 nls = ne - 1;
1458 while ((ols > ofd) && (nls > nfd) && (*ols == *nls))
1459 {
1460 if (*ols != ' ')
1461 wsatend = 0;
1462 ols--;
1463 nls--;
1464 }
1465#if defined (HANDLE_MULTIBYTE)
1466 }
1467#endif
1468
1469 if (wsatend)
1470 {
1471 ols = oe;
1472 nls = ne;
1473 }
1474#if defined (HANDLE_MULTIBYTE)
1475 /* This may not work for stateful encoding, but who cares? To handle
1476 stateful encoding properly, we have to scan each string from the
1477 beginning and compare. */
1478 else if (_rl_compare_chars (ols, 0, NULL, nls, 0, NULL) == 0)
1479#else
1480 else if (*ols != *nls)
1481#endif
1482 {
1483 if (*ols) /* don't step past the NUL */
1484 {
1485 if (MB_CUR_MAX > 1 && rl_byte_oriented == 0)
1486 ols = old + _rl_find_next_mbchar (old, ols - old, 1, MB_FIND_ANY);
1487 else
1488 ols++;
1489 }
1490 if (*nls)
1491 {
1492 if (MB_CUR_MAX > 1 && rl_byte_oriented == 0)
1493 nls = new + _rl_find_next_mbchar (new, nls - new, 1, MB_FIND_ANY);
1494 else
1495 nls++;
1496 }
1497 }
1498
1499 /* count of invisible characters in the current invisible line. */
1500 current_invis_chars = W_OFFSET (current_line, wrap_offset);
1501 if (_rl_last_v_pos != current_line)
1502 {
1503 _rl_move_vert (current_line);
1504 if ((MB_CUR_MAX == 1 || rl_byte_oriented) && current_line == 0 && visible_wrap_offset)
1505 _rl_last_c_pos += visible_wrap_offset;
1506 }
1507
1508 /* If this is the first line and there are invisible characters in the
1509 prompt string, and the prompt string has not changed, and the current
1510 cursor position is before the last invisible character in the prompt,
1511 and the index of the character to move to is past the end of the prompt
1512 string, then redraw the entire prompt string. We can only do this
1513 reliably if the terminal supports a `cr' capability.
1514
1515 This is not an efficiency hack -- there is a problem with redrawing
1516 portions of the prompt string if they contain terminal escape
1517 sequences (like drawing the `unbold' sequence without a corresponding
1518 `bold') that manifests itself on certain terminals. */
1519
1520 lendiff = local_prompt_len;
1521 od = ofd - old; /* index of first difference in visible line */
1522 if (current_line == 0 && !_rl_horizontal_scroll_mode &&
1523 _rl_term_cr && lendiff > prompt_visible_length && _rl_last_c_pos > 0 &&
1524 od >= lendiff && _rl_last_c_pos < PROMPT_ENDING_INDEX)
1525 {
1526#if defined (__MSDOS__)
1527 putc ('\r', rl_outstream);
1528#else
1529 tputs (_rl_term_cr, 1, _rl_output_character_function);
1530#endif
1531 if (modmark)
1532 _rl_output_some_chars ("*", 1);
1533 _rl_output_some_chars (local_prompt, lendiff);
1534 if (MB_CUR_MAX > 1 && rl_byte_oriented == 0)
1535 {
1536 /* We take wrap_offset into account here so we can pass correct
1537 information to _rl_move_cursor_relative. */
1538 _rl_last_c_pos = _rl_col_width (local_prompt, 0, lendiff, 1) - wrap_offset + modmark;
1539 cpos_adjusted = 1;
1540 }
1541 else
1542 _rl_last_c_pos = lendiff + modmark;
1543 }
1544
1545 o_cpos = _rl_last_c_pos;
1546
1547 /* When this function returns, _rl_last_c_pos is correct, and an absolute
1548 cursor postion in multibyte mode, but a buffer index when not in a
1549 multibyte locale. */
1550 _rl_move_cursor_relative (od, old);
1551#if 1
1552#if defined (HANDLE_MULTIBYTE)
1553 /* We need to indicate that the cursor position is correct in the presence of
1554 invisible characters in the prompt string. Let's see if setting this when
1555 we make sure we're at the end of the drawn prompt string works. */
1556 if (current_line == 0 && MB_CUR_MAX > 1 && rl_byte_oriented == 0 &&
1557 (_rl_last_c_pos > 0 || o_cpos > 0) &&
1558 _rl_last_c_pos == prompt_physical_chars)
1559 cpos_adjusted = 1;
1560#endif
1561#endif
1562
1563 /* if (len (new) > len (old))
1564 lendiff == difference in buffer
1565 col_lendiff == difference on screen
1566 When not using multibyte characters, these are equal */
1567 lendiff = (nls - nfd) - (ols - ofd);
1568 if (MB_CUR_MAX > 1 && rl_byte_oriented == 0)
1569 col_lendiff = _rl_col_width (new, nfd - new, nls - new, 1) - _rl_col_width (old, ofd - old, ols - old, 1);
1570 else
1571 col_lendiff = lendiff;
1572
1573 /* If we are changing the number of invisible characters in a line, and
1574 the spot of first difference is before the end of the invisible chars,
1575 lendiff needs to be adjusted. */
1576 if (current_line == 0 && !_rl_horizontal_scroll_mode &&
1577 current_invis_chars != visible_wrap_offset)
1578 {
1579 if (MB_CUR_MAX > 1 && rl_byte_oriented == 0)
1580 {
1581 lendiff += visible_wrap_offset - current_invis_chars;
1582 col_lendiff += visible_wrap_offset - current_invis_chars;
1583 }
1584 else
1585 {
1586 lendiff += visible_wrap_offset - current_invis_chars;
1587 col_lendiff = lendiff;
1588 }
1589 }
1590
1591 /* Insert (diff (len (old), len (new)) ch. */
1592 temp = ne - nfd;
1593 if (MB_CUR_MAX > 1 && rl_byte_oriented == 0)
1594 col_temp = _rl_col_width (new, nfd - new, ne - new, 1);
1595 else
1596 col_temp = temp;
1597
1598 if (col_lendiff > 0) /* XXX - was lendiff */
1599 {
1600 /* Non-zero if we're increasing the number of lines. */
1601 int gl = current_line >= _rl_vis_botlin && inv_botlin > _rl_vis_botlin;
1602 /* If col_lendiff is > 0, implying that the new string takes up more
1603 screen real estate than the old, but lendiff is < 0, meaning that it
1604 takes fewer bytes, we need to just output the characters starting
1605 from the first difference. These will overwrite what is on the
1606 display, so there's no reason to do a smart update. This can really
1607 only happen in a multibyte environment. */
1608 if (lendiff < 0)
1609 {
1610 _rl_output_some_chars (nfd, temp);
1611 _rl_last_c_pos += _rl_col_width (nfd, 0, temp, 1);
1612 /* If nfd begins before any invisible characters in the prompt,
1613 adjust _rl_last_c_pos to account for wrap_offset and set
1614 cpos_adjusted to let the caller know. */
1615 if (current_line == 0 && wrap_offset && ((nfd - new) <= prompt_last_invisible))
1616 {
1617 _rl_last_c_pos -= wrap_offset;
1618 cpos_adjusted = 1;
1619 }
1620 return;
1621 }
1622 /* Sometimes it is cheaper to print the characters rather than
1623 use the terminal's capabilities. If we're growing the number
1624 of lines, make sure we actually cause the new line to wrap
1625 around on auto-wrapping terminals. */
1626 else if (_rl_terminal_can_insert && ((2 * col_temp) >= col_lendiff || _rl_term_IC) && (!_rl_term_autowrap || !gl))
1627 {
1628 /* If lendiff > prompt_visible_length and _rl_last_c_pos == 0 and
1629 _rl_horizontal_scroll_mode == 1, inserting the characters with
1630 _rl_term_IC or _rl_term_ic will screw up the screen because of the
1631 invisible characters. We need to just draw them. */
1632 /* The same thing happens if we're trying to draw before the last
1633 invisible character in the prompt string or we're increasing the
1634 number of invisible characters in the line and we're not drawing
1635 the entire prompt string. */
1636 if (*ols && ((_rl_horizontal_scroll_mode &&
1637 _rl_last_c_pos == 0 &&
1638 lendiff > prompt_visible_length &&
1639 current_invis_chars > 0) == 0) &&
1640 (((MB_CUR_MAX > 1 && rl_byte_oriented == 0) &&
1641 current_line == 0 && wrap_offset &&
1642 ((nfd - new) <= prompt_last_invisible) &&
1643 (col_lendiff < prompt_visible_length)) == 0) &&
1644 (visible_wrap_offset >= current_invis_chars))
1645 {
1646 insert_some_chars (nfd, lendiff, col_lendiff);
1647 _rl_last_c_pos += col_lendiff;
1648 }
1649#if 0 /* XXX - for now */
1650 else if ((MB_CUR_MAX > 1 && rl_byte_oriented == 0) && _rl_last_c_pos == 0 && wrap_offset && (nfd-new) <= prompt_last_invisible && col_lendiff < prompt_visible_length && visible_wrap_offset >= current_invis_chars)
1651 {
1652 _rl_output_some_chars (nfd, lendiff);
1653 _rl_last_c_pos += col_lendiff;
1654 }
1655#endif
1656 else if ((MB_CUR_MAX == 1 || rl_byte_oriented != 0) && *ols == 0 && lendiff > 0)
1657 {
1658 /* At the end of a line the characters do not have to
1659 be "inserted". They can just be placed on the screen. */
1660 /* However, this screws up the rest of this block, which
1661 assumes you've done the insert because you can. */
1662 _rl_output_some_chars (nfd, lendiff);
1663 _rl_last_c_pos += col_lendiff;
1664 }
1665 else
1666 {
1667 _rl_output_some_chars (nfd, temp);
1668 _rl_last_c_pos += col_temp;
1669 /* If nfd begins before the last invisible character in the
1670 prompt, adjust _rl_last_c_pos to account for wrap_offset
1671 and set cpos_adjusted to let the caller know. */
1672 if ((MB_CUR_MAX > 1 && rl_byte_oriented == 0) && current_line == 0 && wrap_offset && ((nfd - new) <= prompt_last_invisible))
1673 {
1674 _rl_last_c_pos -= wrap_offset;
1675 cpos_adjusted = 1;
1676 }
1677 return;
1678 }
1679 /* Copy (new) chars to screen from first diff to last match. */
1680 temp = nls - nfd;
1681 if ((temp - lendiff) > 0)
1682 {
1683 _rl_output_some_chars (nfd + lendiff, temp - lendiff);
1684 /* XXX -- this bears closer inspection. Fixes a redisplay bug
1685 reported against bash-3.0-alpha by Andreas Schwab involving
1686 multibyte characters and prompt strings with invisible
1687 characters, but was previously disabled. */
1688 if (MB_CUR_MAX > 1 && rl_byte_oriented == 0)
1689 twidth = _rl_col_width (nfd+lendiff, 0, temp-col_lendiff, 1);
1690 else
1691 twidth = temp - lendiff;
1692 _rl_last_c_pos += twidth;
1693 /* If nfd begins before the last invisible character in the
1694 prompt, adjust _rl_last_c_pos to account for wrap_offset
1695 and set cpos_adjusted to let the caller know. */
1696 if ((MB_CUR_MAX > 1 && rl_byte_oriented == 0) && current_line == 0 && wrap_offset && ((nfd - new) <= prompt_last_invisible))
1697 {
1698 _rl_last_c_pos -= wrap_offset;
1699 cpos_adjusted = 1;
1700 }
1701 }
1702 }
1703 else
1704 {
1705 /* cannot insert chars, write to EOL */
1706 _rl_output_some_chars (nfd, temp);
1707 _rl_last_c_pos += col_temp;
1708 /* If we're in a multibyte locale and were before the last invisible
1709 char in the current line (which implies we just output some invisible
1710 characters) we need to adjust _rl_last_c_pos, since it represents
1711 a physical character position. */
1712 if ((MB_CUR_MAX > 1 && rl_byte_oriented == 0) &&
1713 current_line == prompt_last_screen_line && wrap_offset &&
1714 wrap_offset != prompt_invis_chars_first_line &&
1715 ((nfd-new) < (prompt_last_invisible-(current_line*_rl_screenwidth))))
1716 {
1717 _rl_last_c_pos -= wrap_offset - prompt_invis_chars_first_line;
1718 cpos_adjusted = 1;
1719 }
1720 }
1721 }
1722 else /* Delete characters from line. */
1723 {
1724 /* If possible and inexpensive to use terminal deletion, then do so. */
1725 if (_rl_term_dc && (2 * col_temp) >= -col_lendiff)
1726 {
1727 /* If all we're doing is erasing the invisible characters in the
1728 prompt string, don't bother. It screws up the assumptions
1729 about what's on the screen. */
1730 if (_rl_horizontal_scroll_mode && _rl_last_c_pos == 0 &&
1731 -lendiff == visible_wrap_offset)
1732 col_lendiff = 0;
1733
1734 if (col_lendiff)
1735 delete_chars (-col_lendiff); /* delete (diff) characters */
1736
1737 /* Copy (new) chars to screen from first diff to last match */
1738 temp = nls - nfd;
1739 if (temp > 0)
1740 {
1741 /* If nfd begins at the prompt, or before the invisible
1742 characters in the prompt, we need to adjust _rl_last_c_pos
1743 in a multibyte locale to account for the wrap offset and
1744 set cpos_adjusted accordingly. */
1745 _rl_output_some_chars (nfd, temp);
1746 if (MB_CUR_MAX > 1 && rl_byte_oriented == 0)
1747 {
1748 _rl_last_c_pos += _rl_col_width (nfd, 0, temp, 1);
1749 if (current_line == 0 && wrap_offset && ((nfd - new) <= prompt_last_invisible))
1750 {
1751 _rl_last_c_pos -= wrap_offset;
1752 cpos_adjusted = 1;
1753 }
1754 }
1755 else
1756 _rl_last_c_pos += temp;
1757 }
1758 }
1759 /* Otherwise, print over the existing material. */
1760 else
1761 {
1762 if (temp > 0)
1763 {
1764 /* If nfd begins at the prompt, or before the invisible
1765 characters in the prompt, we need to adjust _rl_last_c_pos
1766 in a multibyte locale to account for the wrap offset and
1767 set cpos_adjusted accordingly. */
1768 _rl_output_some_chars (nfd, temp);
1769 _rl_last_c_pos += col_temp; /* XXX */
1770 if (MB_CUR_MAX > 1 && rl_byte_oriented == 0)
1771 {
1772 if (current_line == 0 && wrap_offset && ((nfd - new) <= prompt_last_invisible))
1773 {
1774 _rl_last_c_pos -= wrap_offset;
1775 cpos_adjusted = 1;
1776 }
1777 }
1778 }
1779 lendiff = (oe - old) - (ne - new);
1780 if (MB_CUR_MAX > 1 && rl_byte_oriented == 0)
1781 col_lendiff = _rl_col_width (old, 0, oe - old, 1) - _rl_col_width (new, 0, ne - new, 1);
1782 else
1783 col_lendiff = lendiff;
1784
1785#if 0
1786 if (col_lendiff)
1787#else
1788 /* If we've already printed over the entire width of the screen,
1789 including the old material, then col_lendiff doesn't matter and
1790 space_to_eol will insert too many spaces. XXX - maybe we should
1791 adjust col_lendiff based on the difference between _rl_last_c_pos
1792 and _rl_screenwidth */
1793 if (col_lendiff && ((MB_CUR_MAX == 1 || rl_byte_oriented) || (_rl_last_c_pos < _rl_screenwidth)))
1794#endif
1795 {
1796 if (_rl_term_autowrap && current_line < inv_botlin)
1797 space_to_eol (col_lendiff);
1798 else
1799 _rl_clear_to_eol (col_lendiff);
1800 }
1801 }
1802 }
1803}
1804
1805/* Tell the update routines that we have moved onto a new (empty) line. */
1806int
1807rl_on_new_line ()
1808{
1809 if (visible_line)
1810 visible_line[0] = '\0';
1811
1812 _rl_last_c_pos = _rl_last_v_pos = 0;
1813 _rl_vis_botlin = last_lmargin = 0;
1814 if (vis_lbreaks)
1815 vis_lbreaks[0] = vis_lbreaks[1] = 0;
1816 visible_wrap_offset = 0;
1817 return 0;
1818}
1819
1820/* Tell the update routines that we have moved onto a new line with the
1821 prompt already displayed. Code originally from the version of readline
1822 distributed with CLISP. rl_expand_prompt must have already been called
1823 (explicitly or implicitly). This still doesn't work exactly right. */
1824int
1825rl_on_new_line_with_prompt ()
1826{
1827 int prompt_size, i, l, real_screenwidth, newlines;
1828 char *prompt_last_line, *lprompt;
1829
1830 /* Initialize visible_line and invisible_line to ensure that they can hold
1831 the already-displayed prompt. */
1832 prompt_size = strlen (rl_prompt) + 1;
1833 init_line_structures (prompt_size);
1834
1835 /* Make sure the line structures hold the already-displayed prompt for
1836 redisplay. */
1837 lprompt = local_prompt ? local_prompt : rl_prompt;
1838 strcpy (visible_line, lprompt);
1839 strcpy (invisible_line, lprompt);
1840
1841 /* If the prompt contains newlines, take the last tail. */
1842 prompt_last_line = strrchr (rl_prompt, '\n');
1843 if (!prompt_last_line)
1844 prompt_last_line = rl_prompt;
1845
1846 l = strlen (prompt_last_line);
1847 if (MB_CUR_MAX > 1 && rl_byte_oriented == 0)
1848 _rl_last_c_pos = _rl_col_width (prompt_last_line, 0, l, 1); /* XXX */
1849 else
1850 _rl_last_c_pos = l;
1851
1852 /* Dissect prompt_last_line into screen lines. Note that here we have
1853 to use the real screenwidth. Readline's notion of screenwidth might be
1854 one less, see terminal.c. */
1855 real_screenwidth = _rl_screenwidth + (_rl_term_autowrap ? 0 : 1);
1856 _rl_last_v_pos = l / real_screenwidth;
1857 /* If the prompt length is a multiple of real_screenwidth, we don't know
1858 whether the cursor is at the end of the last line, or already at the
1859 beginning of the next line. Output a newline just to be safe. */
1860 if (l > 0 && (l % real_screenwidth) == 0)
1861 _rl_output_some_chars ("\n", 1);
1862 last_lmargin = 0;
1863
1864 newlines = 0; i = 0;
1865 while (i <= l)
1866 {
1867 _rl_vis_botlin = newlines;
1868 vis_lbreaks[newlines++] = i;
1869 i += real_screenwidth;
1870 }
1871 vis_lbreaks[newlines] = l;
1872 visible_wrap_offset = 0;
1873
1874 rl_display_prompt = rl_prompt; /* XXX - make sure it's set */
1875
1876 return 0;
1877}
1878
1879/* Actually update the display, period. */
1880int
1881rl_forced_update_display ()
1882{
1883 register char *temp;
1884
1885 if (visible_line)
1886 {
1887 temp = visible_line;
1888 while (*temp)
1889 *temp++ = '\0';
1890 }
1891 rl_on_new_line ();
1892 forced_display++;
1893 (*rl_redisplay_function) ();
1894 return 0;
1895}
1896
1897/* Move the cursor from _rl_last_c_pos to NEW, which are buffer indices.
1898 (Well, when we don't have multibyte characters, _rl_last_c_pos is a
1899 buffer index.)
1900 DATA is the contents of the screen line of interest; i.e., where
1901 the movement is being done. */
1902void
1903_rl_move_cursor_relative (new, data)
1904 int new;
1905 const char *data;
1906{
1907 register int i;
1908 int woff; /* number of invisible chars on current line */
1909 int cpos, dpos; /* current and desired cursor positions */
1910 int adjust;
1911
1912 woff = WRAP_OFFSET (_rl_last_v_pos, wrap_offset);
1913 cpos = _rl_last_c_pos;
1914
1915 if (cpos == 0 && cpos == new)
1916 return;
1917
1918#if defined (HANDLE_MULTIBYTE)
1919 /* If we have multibyte characters, NEW is indexed by the buffer point in
1920 a multibyte string, but _rl_last_c_pos is the display position. In
1921 this case, NEW's display position is not obvious and must be
1922 calculated. We need to account for invisible characters in this line,
1923 as long as we are past them and they are counted by _rl_col_width. */
1924 if (MB_CUR_MAX > 1 && rl_byte_oriented == 0)
1925 {
1926 adjust = 1;
1927 /* Try to short-circuit common cases and eliminate a bunch of multibyte
1928 character function calls. */
1929 /* 1. prompt string */
1930 if (new == local_prompt_len && memcmp (data, local_prompt, new) == 0)
1931 {
1932 dpos = prompt_physical_chars;
1933 cpos_adjusted = 1;
1934 adjust = 0;
1935 }
1936 /* 2. prompt_string + line contents */
1937 else if (new > local_prompt_len && local_prompt && memcmp (data, local_prompt, local_prompt_len) == 0)
1938 {
1939 dpos = prompt_physical_chars + _rl_col_width (data, local_prompt_len, new, 1);
1940 cpos_adjusted = 1;
1941 adjust = 0;
1942 }
1943 else
1944 dpos = _rl_col_width (data, 0, new, 1);
1945
1946 /* Use NEW when comparing against the last invisible character in the
1947 prompt string, since they're both buffer indices and DPOS is a
1948 desired display position. */
1949 if (adjust && ((new > prompt_last_invisible) || /* XXX - don't use woff here */
1950 (prompt_physical_chars >= _rl_screenwidth &&
1951 _rl_last_v_pos == prompt_last_screen_line &&
1952 wrap_offset >= woff && dpos >= woff &&
1953 new > (prompt_last_invisible-(_rl_screenwidth*_rl_last_v_pos)-wrap_offset))))
1954 /* XXX last comparison might need to be >= */
1955 {
1956 dpos -= woff;
1957 /* Since this will be assigned to _rl_last_c_pos at the end (more
1958 precisely, _rl_last_c_pos == dpos when this function returns),
1959 let the caller know. */
1960 cpos_adjusted = 1;
1961 }
1962 }
1963 else
1964#endif
1965 dpos = new;
1966
1967 /* If we don't have to do anything, then return. */
1968 if (cpos == dpos)
1969 return;
1970
1971 /* It may be faster to output a CR, and then move forwards instead
1972 of moving backwards. */
1973 /* i == current physical cursor position. */
1974#if defined (HANDLE_MULTIBYTE)
1975 if (MB_CUR_MAX > 1 && rl_byte_oriented == 0)
1976 i = _rl_last_c_pos;
1977 else
1978#endif
1979 i = _rl_last_c_pos - woff;
1980 if (dpos == 0 || CR_FASTER (dpos, _rl_last_c_pos) ||
1981 (_rl_term_autowrap && i == _rl_screenwidth))
1982 {
1983#if defined (__MSDOS__)
1984 putc ('\r', rl_outstream);
1985#else
1986 tputs (_rl_term_cr, 1, _rl_output_character_function);
1987#endif /* !__MSDOS__ */
1988 cpos = _rl_last_c_pos = 0;
1989 }
1990
1991 if (cpos < dpos)
1992 {
1993 /* Move the cursor forward. We do it by printing the command
1994 to move the cursor forward if there is one, else print that
1995 portion of the output buffer again. Which is cheaper? */
1996
1997 /* The above comment is left here for posterity. It is faster
1998 to print one character (non-control) than to print a control
1999 sequence telling the terminal to move forward one character.
2000 That kind of control is for people who don't know what the
2001 data is underneath the cursor. */
2002
2003 /* However, we need a handle on where the current display position is
2004 in the buffer for the immediately preceding comment to be true.
2005 In multibyte locales, we don't currently have that info available.
2006 Without it, we don't know where the data we have to display begins
2007 in the buffer and we have to go back to the beginning of the screen
2008 line. In this case, we can use the terminal sequence to move forward
2009 if it's available. */
2010 if (MB_CUR_MAX > 1 && rl_byte_oriented == 0)
2011 {
2012 if (_rl_term_forward_char)
2013 {
2014 for (i = cpos; i < dpos; i++)
2015 tputs (_rl_term_forward_char, 1, _rl_output_character_function);
2016 }
2017 else
2018 {
2019 tputs (_rl_term_cr, 1, _rl_output_character_function);
2020 for (i = 0; i < new; i++)
2021 putc (data[i], rl_outstream);
2022 }
2023 }
2024 else
2025 for (i = cpos; i < new; i++)
2026 putc (data[i], rl_outstream);
2027 }
2028
2029#if defined (HANDLE_MULTIBYTE)
2030 /* NEW points to the buffer point, but _rl_last_c_pos is the display point.
2031 The byte length of the string is probably bigger than the column width
2032 of the string, which means that if NEW == _rl_last_c_pos, then NEW's
2033 display point is less than _rl_last_c_pos. */
2034#endif
2035 else if (cpos > dpos)
2036 _rl_backspace (cpos - dpos);
2037
2038 _rl_last_c_pos = dpos;
2039}
2040
2041/* PWP: move the cursor up or down. */
2042void
2043_rl_move_vert (to)
2044 int to;
2045{
2046 register int delta, i;
2047
2048 if (_rl_last_v_pos == to || to > _rl_screenheight)
2049 return;
2050
2051 if ((delta = to - _rl_last_v_pos) > 0)
2052 {
2053 for (i = 0; i < delta; i++)
2054 putc ('\n', rl_outstream);
2055#if defined (__MSDOS__)
2056 putc ('\r', rl_outstream);
2057#else
2058 tputs (_rl_term_cr, 1, _rl_output_character_function);
2059#endif
2060 _rl_last_c_pos = 0;
2061 }
2062 else
2063 { /* delta < 0 */
2064#ifdef __MSDOS__
2065 int row, col;
2066
2067 fflush (rl_outstream); /* make sure the cursor pos is current! */
2068 ScreenGetCursor (&row, &col);
2069 ScreenSetCursor (row + delta, col);
2070 i = -delta; /* in case someone wants to use it after the loop */
2071#else /* !__MSDOS__ */
2072 if (_rl_term_up && *_rl_term_up)
2073 for (i = 0; i < -delta; i++)
2074 tputs (_rl_term_up, 1, _rl_output_character_function);
2075#endif /* !__MSDOS__ */
2076 }
2077
2078 _rl_last_v_pos = to; /* Now TO is here */
2079}
2080
2081/* Physically print C on rl_outstream. This is for functions which know
2082 how to optimize the display. Return the number of characters output. */
2083int
2084rl_show_char (c)
2085 int c;
2086{
2087 int n = 1;
2088 if (META_CHAR (c) && (_rl_output_meta_chars == 0))
2089 {
2090 fprintf (rl_outstream, "M-");
2091 n += 2;
2092 c = UNMETA (c);
2093 }
2094
2095#if defined (DISPLAY_TABS)
2096 if ((CTRL_CHAR (c) && c != '\t') || c == RUBOUT)
2097#else
2098 if (CTRL_CHAR (c) || c == RUBOUT)
2099#endif /* !DISPLAY_TABS */
2100 {
2101 fprintf (rl_outstream, "C-");
2102 n += 2;
2103 c = CTRL_CHAR (c) ? UNCTRL (c) : '?';
2104 }
2105
2106 putc (c, rl_outstream);
2107 fflush (rl_outstream);
2108 return n;
2109}
2110
2111int
2112rl_character_len (c, pos)
2113 register int c, pos;
2114{
2115 unsigned char uc;
2116
2117 uc = (unsigned char)c;
2118
2119 if (META_CHAR (uc))
2120 return ((_rl_output_meta_chars == 0) ? 4 : 1);
2121
2122 if (uc == '\t')
2123 {
2124#if defined (DISPLAY_TABS)
2125 return (((pos | 7) + 1) - pos);
2126#else
2127 return (2);
2128#endif /* !DISPLAY_TABS */
2129 }
2130
2131 if (CTRL_CHAR (c) || c == RUBOUT)
2132 return (2);
2133
2134 return ((ISPRINT (uc)) ? 1 : 2);
2135}
2136/* How to print things in the "echo-area". The prompt is treated as a
2137 mini-modeline. */
2138static int msg_saved_prompt = 0;
2139
2140#if defined (USE_VARARGS)
2141int
2142#if defined (PREFER_STDARG)
2143rl_message (const char *format, ...)
2144#else
2145rl_message (va_alist)
2146 va_dcl
2147#endif
2148{
2149 va_list args;
2150#if defined (PREFER_VARARGS)
2151 char *format;
2152#endif
2153
2154#if defined (PREFER_STDARG)
2155 va_start (args, format);
2156#else
2157 va_start (args);
2158 format = va_arg (args, char *);
2159#endif
2160
2161#if defined (HAVE_VSNPRINTF)
2162 vsnprintf (msg_buf, sizeof (msg_buf) - 1, format, args);
2163#else
2164 vsprintf (msg_buf, format, args);
2165 msg_buf[sizeof(msg_buf) - 1] = '\0'; /* overflow? */
2166#endif
2167 va_end (args);
2168
2169 if (saved_local_prompt == 0)
2170 {
2171 rl_save_prompt ();
2172 msg_saved_prompt = 1;
2173 }
2174 rl_display_prompt = msg_buf;
2175 local_prompt = expand_prompt (msg_buf, &prompt_visible_length,
2176 &prompt_last_invisible,
2177 &prompt_invis_chars_first_line,
2178 &prompt_physical_chars);
2179 local_prompt_prefix = (char *)NULL;
2180 local_prompt_len = local_prompt ? strlen (local_prompt) : 0;
2181 (*rl_redisplay_function) ();
2182
2183 return 0;
2184}
2185#else /* !USE_VARARGS */
2186int
2187rl_message (format, arg1, arg2)
2188 char *format;
2189{
2190 sprintf (msg_buf, format, arg1, arg2);
2191 msg_buf[sizeof(msg_buf) - 1] = '\0'; /* overflow? */
2192
2193 rl_display_prompt = msg_buf;
2194 if (saved_local_prompt == 0)
2195 {
2196 rl_save_prompt ();
2197 msg_saved_prompt = 1;
2198 }
2199 local_prompt = expand_prompt (msg_buf, &prompt_visible_length,
2200 &prompt_last_invisible,
2201 &prompt_invis_chars_first_line,
2202 &prompt_physical_chars);
2203 local_prompt_prefix = (char *)NULL;
2204 local_prompt_len = local_prompt ? strlen (local_prompt) : 0;
2205 (*rl_redisplay_function) ();
2206
2207 return 0;
2208}
2209#endif /* !USE_VARARGS */
2210
2211/* How to clear things from the "echo-area". */
2212int
2213rl_clear_message ()
2214{
2215 rl_display_prompt = rl_prompt;
2216 if (msg_saved_prompt)
2217 {
2218 rl_restore_prompt ();
2219 msg_saved_prompt = 0;
2220 }
2221 (*rl_redisplay_function) ();
2222 return 0;
2223}
2224
2225int
2226rl_reset_line_state ()
2227{
2228 rl_on_new_line ();
2229
2230 rl_display_prompt = rl_prompt ? rl_prompt : "";
2231 forced_display = 1;
2232 return 0;
2233}
2234
2235void
2236rl_save_prompt ()
2237{
2238 saved_local_prompt = local_prompt;
2239 saved_local_prefix = local_prompt_prefix;
2240 saved_prefix_length = prompt_prefix_length;
2241 saved_local_length = local_prompt_len;
2242 saved_last_invisible = prompt_last_invisible;
2243 saved_visible_length = prompt_visible_length;
2244 saved_invis_chars_first_line = prompt_invis_chars_first_line;
2245 saved_physical_chars = prompt_physical_chars;
2246
2247 local_prompt = local_prompt_prefix = (char *)0;
2248 local_prompt_len = 0;
2249 prompt_last_invisible = prompt_visible_length = prompt_prefix_length = 0;
2250 prompt_invis_chars_first_line = prompt_physical_chars = 0;
2251}
2252
2253void
2254rl_restore_prompt ()
2255{
2256 FREE (local_prompt);
2257 FREE (local_prompt_prefix);
2258
2259 local_prompt = saved_local_prompt;
2260 local_prompt_prefix = saved_local_prefix;
2261 local_prompt_len = saved_local_length;
2262 prompt_prefix_length = saved_prefix_length;
2263 prompt_last_invisible = saved_last_invisible;
2264 prompt_visible_length = saved_visible_length;
2265 prompt_invis_chars_first_line = saved_invis_chars_first_line;
2266 prompt_physical_chars = saved_physical_chars;
2267
2268 /* can test saved_local_prompt to see if prompt info has been saved. */
2269 saved_local_prompt = saved_local_prefix = (char *)0;
2270 saved_local_length = 0;
2271 saved_last_invisible = saved_visible_length = saved_prefix_length = 0;
2272 saved_invis_chars_first_line = saved_physical_chars = 0;
2273}
2274
2275char *
2276_rl_make_prompt_for_search (pchar)
2277 int pchar;
2278{
2279 int len;
2280 char *pmt, *p;
2281
2282 rl_save_prompt ();
2283
2284 /* We've saved the prompt, and can do anything with the various prompt
2285 strings we need before they're restored. We want the unexpanded
2286 portion of the prompt string after any final newline. */
2287 p = rl_prompt ? strrchr (rl_prompt, '\n') : 0;
2288 if (p == 0)
2289 {
2290 len = (rl_prompt && *rl_prompt) ? strlen (rl_prompt) : 0;
2291 pmt = (char *)xmalloc (len + 2);
2292 if (len)
2293 strcpy (pmt, rl_prompt);
2294 pmt[len] = pchar;
2295 pmt[len+1] = '\0';
2296 }
2297 else
2298 {
2299 p++;
2300 len = strlen (p);
2301 pmt = (char *)xmalloc (len + 2);
2302 if (len)
2303 strcpy (pmt, p);
2304 pmt[len] = pchar;
2305 pmt[len+1] = '\0';
2306 }
2307
2308 /* will be overwritten by expand_prompt, called from rl_message */
2309 prompt_physical_chars = saved_physical_chars + 1;
2310 return pmt;
2311}
2312
2313/* Quick redisplay hack when erasing characters at the end of the line. */
2314void
2315_rl_erase_at_end_of_line (l)
2316 int l;
2317{
2318 register int i;
2319
2320 _rl_backspace (l);
2321 for (i = 0; i < l; i++)
2322 putc (' ', rl_outstream);
2323 _rl_backspace (l);
2324 for (i = 0; i < l; i++)
2325 visible_line[--_rl_last_c_pos] = '\0';
2326 rl_display_fixed++;
2327}
2328
2329/* Clear to the end of the line. COUNT is the minimum
2330 number of character spaces to clear, */
2331void
2332_rl_clear_to_eol (count)
2333 int count;
2334{
2335#ifndef __MSDOS__
2336 if (_rl_term_clreol)
2337 tputs (_rl_term_clreol, 1, _rl_output_character_function);
2338 else
2339#endif
2340 if (count)
2341 space_to_eol (count);
2342}
2343
2344/* Clear to the end of the line using spaces. COUNT is the minimum
2345 number of character spaces to clear, */
2346static void
2347space_to_eol (count)
2348 int count;
2349{
2350 register int i;
2351
2352 for (i = 0; i < count; i++)
2353 putc (' ', rl_outstream);
2354
2355 _rl_last_c_pos += count;
2356}
2357
2358void
2359_rl_clear_screen ()
2360{
2361#if defined (__GO32__)
2362 ScreenClear (); /* FIXME: only works in text modes */
2363 ScreenSetCursor (0, 0); /* term_clrpag is "cl" which homes the cursor */
2364#else
2365 if (_rl_term_clrpag)
2366 tputs (_rl_term_clrpag, 1, _rl_output_character_function);
2367 else
2368 rl_crlf ();
2369#endif
2370}
2371
2372/* Insert COUNT characters from STRING to the output stream at column COL. */
2373static void
2374insert_some_chars (string, count, col)
2375 char *string;
2376 int count, col;
2377{
2378#if defined (__MSDOS__) || (defined (__MINGW32__) && !defined (NCURSES_VERSION))
2379 _rl_output_some_chars (string, count);
2380#else
2381 /* DEBUGGING */
2382 if (MB_CUR_MAX == 1 || rl_byte_oriented)
2383 if (count != col)
2384 _rl_ttymsg ("debug: insert_some_chars: count (%d) != col (%d)", count, col);
2385
2386 /* If IC is defined, then we do not have to "enter" insert mode. */
2387 if (_rl_term_IC)
2388 {
2389 char *buffer;
2390
2391 buffer = tgoto (_rl_term_IC, 0, col);
2392 tputs (buffer, 1, _rl_output_character_function);
2393 _rl_output_some_chars (string, count);
2394 }
2395 else
2396 {
2397 register int i;
2398
2399 /* If we have to turn on insert-mode, then do so. */
2400 if (_rl_term_im && *_rl_term_im)
2401 tputs (_rl_term_im, 1, _rl_output_character_function);
2402
2403 /* If there is a special command for inserting characters, then
2404 use that first to open up the space. */
2405 if (_rl_term_ic && *_rl_term_ic)
2406 {
2407 for (i = col; i--; )
2408 tputs (_rl_term_ic, 1, _rl_output_character_function);
2409 }
2410
2411 /* Print the text. */
2412 _rl_output_some_chars (string, count);
2413
2414 /* If there is a string to turn off insert mode, we had best use
2415 it now. */
2416 if (_rl_term_ei && *_rl_term_ei)
2417 tputs (_rl_term_ei, 1, _rl_output_character_function);
2418 }
2419#endif /* __MSDOS__ || __MINGW32__ */
2420}
2421
2422/* Delete COUNT characters from the display line. */
2423static void
2424delete_chars (count)
2425 int count;
2426{
2427 if (count > _rl_screenwidth) /* XXX */
2428 return;
2429
2430#if !defined (__MSDOS__) && !(defined (__MINGW32__) && !defined (NCURSES_VERSION))
2431 if (_rl_term_DC && *_rl_term_DC)
2432 {
2433 char *buffer;
2434 buffer = tgoto (_rl_term_DC, count, count);
2435 tputs (buffer, count, _rl_output_character_function);
2436 }
2437 else
2438 {
2439 if (_rl_term_dc && *_rl_term_dc)
2440 while (count--)
2441 tputs (_rl_term_dc, 1, _rl_output_character_function);
2442 }
2443#endif /* !__MSDOS__ && !__MINGW32__ */
2444}
2445
2446void
2447_rl_update_final ()
2448{
2449 int full_lines;
2450
2451 full_lines = 0;
2452 /* If the cursor is the only thing on an otherwise-blank last line,
2453 compensate so we don't print an extra CRLF. */
2454 if (_rl_vis_botlin && _rl_last_c_pos == 0 &&
2455 visible_line[vis_lbreaks[_rl_vis_botlin]] == 0)
2456 {
2457 _rl_vis_botlin--;
2458 full_lines = 1;
2459 }
2460 _rl_move_vert (_rl_vis_botlin);
2461 /* If we've wrapped lines, remove the final xterm line-wrap flag. */
2462 if (full_lines && _rl_term_autowrap && (VIS_LLEN(_rl_vis_botlin) == _rl_screenwidth))
2463 {
2464 char *last_line;
2465
2466 last_line = &visible_line[vis_lbreaks[_rl_vis_botlin]];
2467 cpos_buffer_position = -1; /* don't know where we are in buffer */
2468 _rl_move_cursor_relative (_rl_screenwidth - 1, last_line); /* XXX */
2469 _rl_clear_to_eol (0);
2470 putc (last_line[_rl_screenwidth - 1], rl_outstream);
2471 }
2472 _rl_vis_botlin = 0;
2473 rl_crlf ();
2474 fflush (rl_outstream);
2475 rl_display_fixed++;
2476}
2477
2478/* Move to the start of the current line. */
2479static void
2480cr ()
2481{
2482 if (_rl_term_cr)
2483 {
2484#if defined (__MSDOS__)
2485 putc ('\r', rl_outstream);
2486#else
2487 tputs (_rl_term_cr, 1, _rl_output_character_function);
2488#endif
2489 _rl_last_c_pos = 0;
2490 }
2491}
2492
2493/* Redraw the last line of a multi-line prompt that may possibly contain
2494 terminal escape sequences. Called with the cursor at column 0 of the
2495 line to draw the prompt on. */
2496static void
2497redraw_prompt (t)
2498 char *t;
2499{
2500 char *oldp;
2501
2502 oldp = rl_display_prompt;
2503 rl_save_prompt ();
2504
2505 rl_display_prompt = t;
2506 local_prompt = expand_prompt (t, &prompt_visible_length,
2507 &prompt_last_invisible,
2508 &prompt_invis_chars_first_line,
2509 &prompt_physical_chars);
