2510 local_prompt_prefix = (char *)NULL;
2511 local_prompt_len = local_prompt ? strlen (local_prompt) : 0;
2512
2513 rl_forced_update_display ();
2514
2515 rl_display_prompt = oldp;
2516 rl_restore_prompt();
2517}
2518
2519/* Redisplay the current line after a SIGWINCH is received. */
2520void
2521_rl_redisplay_after_sigwinch ()
2522{
2523 char *t;
2524
2525 /* Clear the last line (assuming that the screen size change will result in
2526 either more or fewer characters on that line only) and put the cursor at
2527 column 0. Make sure the right thing happens if we have wrapped to a new
2528 screen line. */
2529 if (_rl_term_cr)
2530 {
2531 _rl_move_vert (_rl_vis_botlin);
2532
2533#if defined (__MSDOS__)
2534 putc ('\r', rl_outstream);
2535#else
2536 tputs (_rl_term_cr, 1, _rl_output_character_function);
2537#endif
2538 _rl_last_c_pos = 0;
2539#if defined (__MSDOS__)
2540 space_to_eol (_rl_screenwidth);
2541 putc ('\r', rl_outstream);
2542#else
2543 if (_rl_term_clreol)
2544 tputs (_rl_term_clreol, 1, _rl_output_character_function);
2545 else
2546 {
2547 space_to_eol (_rl_screenwidth);
2548 tputs (_rl_term_cr, 1, _rl_output_character_function);
2549 }
2550#endif
2551 if (_rl_last_v_pos > 0)
2552 _rl_move_vert (0);
2553 }
2554 else
2555 rl_crlf ();
2556
2557 /* Redraw only the last line of a multi-line prompt. */
2558 t = strrchr (rl_display_prompt, '\n');
2559 if (t)
2560 redraw_prompt (++t);
2561 else
2562 rl_forced_update_display ();
2563}
2564
2565void
2566_rl_clean_up_for_exit ()
2567{
2568 if (_rl_echoing_p)
2569 {
2570 _rl_move_vert (_rl_vis_botlin);
2571 _rl_vis_botlin = 0;
2572 fflush (rl_outstream);
2573 rl_restart_output (1, 0);
2574 }
2575}
2576
2577void
2578_rl_erase_entire_line ()
2579{
2580 cr ();
2581 _rl_clear_to_eol (0);
2582 cr ();
2583 fflush (rl_outstream);
2584}
2585
2586/* return the `current display line' of the cursor -- the number of lines to
2587 move up to get to the first screen line of the current readline line. */
2588int
2589_rl_current_display_line ()
2590{
2591 int ret, nleft;
2592
2593 /* Find out whether or not there might be invisible characters in the
2594 editing buffer. */
2595 if (rl_display_prompt == rl_prompt)
2596 nleft = _rl_last_c_pos - _rl_screenwidth - rl_visible_prompt_length;
2597 else
2598 nleft = _rl_last_c_pos - _rl_screenwidth;
2599
2600 if (nleft > 0)
2601 ret = 1 + nleft / _rl_screenwidth;
2602 else
2603 ret = 0;
2604
2605 return ret;
2606}
2607
2608#if defined (HANDLE_MULTIBYTE)
2609/* Calculate the number of screen columns occupied by STR from START to END.
2610 In the case of multibyte characters with stateful encoding, we have to
2611 scan from the beginning of the string to take the state into account. */
2612static int
2613_rl_col_width (str, start, end, flags)
2614 const char *str;
2615 int start, end, flags;
2616{
2617 wchar_t wc;
2618 mbstate_t ps;
2619 int tmp, point, width, max;
2620
2621 if (end <= start)
2622 return 0;
2623 if (MB_CUR_MAX == 1 || rl_byte_oriented)
2624{
2625_rl_ttymsg ("_rl_col_width: called with MB_CUR_MAX == 1");
2626 return (end - start);
2627}
2628
2629 memset (&ps, 0, sizeof (mbstate_t));
2630
2631 point = 0;
2632 max = end;
2633
2634 /* Try to short-circuit common cases. The adjustment to remove wrap_offset
2635 is done by the caller. */
2636 /* 1. prompt string */
2637 if (flags && start == 0 && end == local_prompt_len && memcmp (str, local_prompt, local_prompt_len) == 0)
2638 return (prompt_physical_chars + wrap_offset);
2639 /* 2. prompt string + line contents */
2640 else if (flags && start == 0 && local_prompt_len > 0 && end > local_prompt_len && local_prompt && memcmp (str, local_prompt, local_prompt_len) == 0)
2641 {
2642 tmp = prompt_physical_chars + wrap_offset;
2643 /* XXX - try to call ourselves recursively with non-prompt portion */
2644 tmp += _rl_col_width (str, local_prompt_len, end, flags);
2645 return (tmp);
2646 }
2647
2648 while (point < start)
2649 {
2650 tmp = mbrlen (str + point, max, &ps);
2651 if (MB_INVALIDCH ((size_t)tmp))
2652 {
2653 /* In this case, the bytes are invalid or too short to compose a
2654 multibyte character, so we assume that the first byte represents
2655 a single character. */
2656 point++;
2657 max--;
2658
2659 /* Clear the state of the byte sequence, because in this case the
2660 effect of mbstate is undefined. */
2661 memset (&ps, 0, sizeof (mbstate_t));
2662 }
2663 else if (MB_NULLWCH (tmp))
2664 break; /* Found '\0' */
2665 else
2666 {
2667 point += tmp;
2668 max -= tmp;
2669 }
2670 }
2671
2672 /* If START is not a byte that starts a character, then POINT will be
2673 greater than START. In this case, assume that (POINT - START) gives
2674 a byte count that is the number of columns of difference. */
2675 width = point - start;
2676
2677 while (point < end)
2678 {
2679 tmp = mbrtowc (&wc, str + point, max, &ps);
2680 if (MB_INVALIDCH ((size_t)tmp))
2681 {
2682 /* In this case, the bytes are invalid or too short to compose a
2683 multibyte character, so we assume that the first byte represents
2684 a single character. */
2685 point++;
2686 max--;
2687
2688 /* and assume that the byte occupies a single column. */
2689 width++;
2690
2691 /* Clear the state of the byte sequence, because in this case the
2692 effect of mbstate is undefined. */
2693 memset (&ps, 0, sizeof (mbstate_t));
2694 }
2695 else if (MB_NULLWCH (tmp))
2696 break; /* Found '\0' */
2697 else
2698 {
2699 point += tmp;
2700 max -= tmp;
2701 tmp = wcwidth(wc);
2702 width += (tmp >= 0) ? tmp : 1;
2703 }
2704 }
2705
2706 width += point - end;
2707
2708 return width;
2709}
2710#endif /* HANDLE_MULTIBYTE */
2711
